DataElement.preferredName: Disease Screening Guidelines Awareness Assessment  Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Yes/no indicator to determine is a person is aware of screening guidelines.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Checking for disease when there are no symptoms._Directions or principles presenting current or future rules of policy. Guidelines may be developed by government agencies at any level, institutions, professional societies, governing boards, or by the convening of expert panels. The text may be cursive or in outline form but is generally a comprehensive guide to problems and approaches in any field of activity. For guidelines in the field of health care and clinical medicine, PRACTICE GUIDELINES is available._Knowing that something exists, or having knowledge or experience of a particular thing; having special interest in or experience of something and so being well informed of what is happening in that subject at the present time._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Guidelines may be developed by government agencies at any level, institutions, professional societies, governing boards, or by the convening of expert panels. Concepts.definition: The use of any device, marker, or other means for the purpose of detecting the presence of disease, usually in asymptomatic individuals.

A systematic statement of policy rules or principles. Guidelines may be developed by government agencies at any level, institutions, professional societies, governing boards, or by convening expert panels.

Knowing that something exists, or having knowledge or experience of a particular thing; having special interest in or experience of something and so being well informed of what is happening in that subject at the present time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
